p: The protein fractions of cashew nut were extracted using the Osborne method as follows [ 34]. The defatted cashew nut flour was dispersed in deionised water (1:10, w/v) and stirred for 2 h at room temperature. The suspension was then centrifuged at 6000× g for 30 min and the supernatant was collected as the albumin extract. The precipitate was extracted with 1 M NaCl (1:10, w/v) for 2 h and centrifuged to give the globulin fraction. The residue was then extracted with 70% ethanol to give prolamin, followed by glutelin extraction with 0.1 M NaOH. To further clarify the supernatant of insoluble residues, each extraction was performed twice. Then the protein fractions were dialyzed (6–8 kDa cut off) against water at 4 °C for 72 h, freeze-dried and stored at 4 °C.
